au.gov.sbr.xml.signature
Class AsymmetricSign

java.lang.Object
  au.gov.sbr.xml.signature.AsymmetricSign

public class AsymmetricSign
extends java.lang.Object

A bunch of helper methods for adding XML digital signatures to an XML document.

Method Detail

sign

public static java.lang.String sign(java.lang.String message,
                                    java.security.Key key,
                                    java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodesToSign)
Takes a string representation of an XML document and adds a digital signature. As no id attribute is added this value is set to null.

Example:
 <body id="body">
   <message id="message">
   </message>
   <foo id="foo">
   </foo>
 </body>

Passing "body" and "foo" in nodesToSign will sign the body and foo elements.

Parameters:
message - the XML message to be signed.
key - the RSA private key to use for signing.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
nodesToSign - the list of Nodes to sign. These should be a list of ID names found in the document.

sign

public static java.lang.String sign(java.lang.String message,
                                    java.security.Key key,
                                    java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodesToSign,
                                    java.lang.String idAttributeValue)
Takes a string representation of an XML document and adds a digital signature. The XML document must already have id attributes on the elements that are to be signed and these id attributes should be listed in the nodesToSign parameter.

Example:
 <body id="body">
   <message id="message">
   </message>
   <foo id="foo">
   </foo>
 </body>

Passing "body" and "foo" in nodesToSign will sign the body and foo elements.

Parameters:
message - the XML message to be signed.
key - the RSA private key to use for signing.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
nodesToSign - the list of Nodes to sign. These should be a list of ID names found in the document.
idAttributeValue - the value to put in the id attribute on the signature. No id attribute is added if this value is null or the empty string.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - when an exception is thrown inside the method body. This exception wraps the exception that cause.

sign

public static void sign(org.w3c.dom.Document message,
                        java.security.Key key,
                        java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodesToSign)
Takes a DOM representation of an XML document and adds an XML digital signature to it. The orginal DOM object tree is modified in calling this routine. As no id attribute is added this value is set to null.

Example:

 <body id="body">
   <message id="message">
   </message>
   <foo id="foo">
   </foo>
 </body>

Passing in "body" and "foo" in nodesToSign will sign the body and foo elements.

Parameters:
message - the XML message to be signed.
key - the RSA private key to use for signing.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
nodesToSign - the list of Nodes to sign. These should be a list of ID names found in the document.

sign

public static void sign(org.w3c.dom.Document message,
                        java.security.Key key,
                        java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodesToSign,
                        java.lang.String idAttributeValue)
Takes a DOM representation of an XML document and adds an XML digital signature to it. The orginal DOM object tree is modified in calling this routine. The XML document must already have id attributes on the elements that are to be signed and these id attributes should be listed in the nodesToSign parameter.

Example:

 <body id="body">
   <message id="message">
   </message>
   <foo id="foo">
   </foo>
 </body>

Passing in "body" and "foo" in nodesToSign will sign the body and foo elements.

Parameters:
message - the XML message to be signed.
key - the RSA private key to use for signing.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
nodesToSign - the list of Nodes to sign. These should be a list of ID names found in the document.
idAttributeValue - the value to put in the id attribute on the signature. No id attribute is added if this value is null or the empty string.

sign

public static void sign(XMLUtils.SoapVersion soapVersion,
                        org.w3c.dom.Document message,
                        java.security.Key key,
                        java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodesToSign,
                        java.lang.String signatureIdAttributeValue)
Takes a DOM representation of an XML document and adds an XML digital signature to it. The orginal DOM object tree is modified in calling this routine. The XML document must already have id attributes on the elements that are to be signed and these id attributes should be listed in the nodesToSign parameter.

Example:

 <body id="body">
   <message id="message">
   </message>
   <foo id="foo">
   </foo>
 </body>

Passing in "body" and "foo" in nodesToSign will sign the body and foo elements.

Parameters:
message - the XML message to be signed.
key - the RSA private key to use for signing.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
nodesToSign - the list of Nodes to sign. These should be a list of ID names found in the document.
signatureIdAttributeValue - the value to put in the id attribute on the signature. No id attribute is added if this value is null or the empty string.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - when an exception is thrown inside the method body. This exception wraps the exception that cause.

validate

public static boolean validate(java.lang.String message,
                               java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert)
Validates a signed WSSE message.

Parameters:
message - the SOAP/XML document message to be signed.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
Returns:
status of the validation.

validate

public static boolean validate(org.w3c.dom.Document message,
                               java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert)
Attempts to validates a signed WSSE message.

Parameters:
message - the SOAP/XML document message to be signed.
cert - the X509 certificate with the RSA public key that is paired with the key parameter. Used to add an identifier to the signature.
Returns:
status of the validation.
